body: @carlvine500 Is there a parent thread? I think the better case is dubbo1 -> dubbo2( dubbo-service -> cross-thread -> Jedis). Can you provide one?

telnet can invoke dubbo : 
telnet  localhost 20880  --> dubbo-provider --> redis
I think you have updated your comments. I receive a different comment from my mail notification. Is trace broken? If so, there must be a bug existed.
@peng-yongsheng You should pay attention on this issue. And check your trace segment query for cross-thread trace.
new case : telnet --> dubbo-provider3 --> dubbo-provider2 --> redis but topology can't show

@peng-yongsheng Please recheck this.

@ascrutae I have a concern about my implementation, when collector checks token with an invalid result, I throw a runtime exception for stopping the service call. I am sure it is the right way. So I am checking with gRPC team leader @ejona86 .

Also please run the test for this feature.

Do not throw. Call `serverCall.close()` instead. I discuss this some in this SO answer: https://stackoverflow.com/a/38313554/4690866

> This echos the request metadata as response metadata. I think you want new Metadata() instead of metadata on this line.

@ejona86 So, do you mean, the metadata of interceptCall begin with request metadata, until some filter override it with a new meta data?
@lilanlong I'm not sure this is a real problem. Do you delete or clean the elasticsearch data?

I don't think update the elasticsearch version to 5.6.2 is a good idea. 
I think we have two choice: 
1. Update to 5.6.8, this is 5.x.x's final version.
1. Update to 6.x.x, use the http rest client, because of transport client will be disappear when 7.x release.
I prefer to update after our features stable.

1. it is ok.
2.document is ok.In fact ,the http module is copy from es module then change impl to http.Every class is some in es module.So the support is easy.
3.I think it is impossible in few days . i think should treat me as a free contribuor not a worker in 58. The new feature is non of 58's business. If i am not a employee in a company , so what?  I think the core question is the module are so large and need some test.I will take care the tests.

> 3.I think it is impossible in few days . i think should treat me as a free contribuor not a worker in 58. The new feature is non of 58's business. If i am not a employee in a company , so what? I think the core question is the module are so large and need some test.I will take care the tests.

We always treat every contributor as individual. The major concern is about maintaining. I am not worried about providing a feature with bug( every one's codes have bugs ), instead, I am worried have no one to fix bugs in time.

Another reason I asked for public news, is about the end user cases of this features. The community is driven by the end users, right?

Hope I explain myself clear. :)

So if you want to try, we can accept this as an incubating feature first. But then, you have the following responsibilities:
1. Take part in test and Apache release process, because after merged, this feature is part of it.
1. Sync the changes in our default es implementations.

The incubating feature at least last 3-6 month, if this feature is stable, has public user case for this feature, and you are still active, we can change this into core feature, even default implementation. 

@cyberdak Is this good enough for you?

If so, you should work on resolve conflicts and documents, including settings, usage, and log to tell people how to change the implementation to ES-http.

And please test es-http storage after you sync the master's codes. 

BTW, I am definitely sure, there are several new type(table)s are going to add in beta.

Coverage remained the same at 19.528% when pulling **7a0878878f4d67f2a97171462e9a5478dc9a56c7 on candyleer:all_request_error** into **bcf97b60bd8309b6fa5e3e711eb5a444a91f3049 on apache:master**.
FYI @acurtain

Return 0 is not a good idea when calls equals error calls.
Suggest:
1. calls > error calls: 
    - TPS: ( calls -  error calls) / seconds between
    - AVG response time: ( response times - error response times ) / ( calls -  error calls )
1. calls == error calls
    - TPS: calls / seconds between
    - AVG response time: ( response times / calls )

@wu-sheng

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/16331487/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/16331487)

Coverage remained the same at 19.528% when pulling **26969f05ce8819b5bde29bcc953045811a56a51b on peng-yongsheng:document/1010** into **1deb90a24aeeda5a5631af2d2132f85e0f77f667 on apache:master**.

i think @peng-yongsheng 's definition for TPS and AVG are properly
otherwise 0 seem suddenly image that when i request several  times for some urls but the data always 0...

@peng-yongsheng if we intend to process error in tps and avg reponse time, I think there are three metrics
1. calls and avg response time of all calls
1. calls and avg responsr time of sucess calls
1. calls and avg response timr of fail calls

In current version, I prefer the 2). If you want more, I am OK. But I dont like change the metric meaning in different condition. If you want those, I suggest to add more metrics in query results. And discuss with @hanahmily to decide how to visualize them.

@wu-sheng I choose 1 (calls and avg response time of all calls).  The user will very doubt when the TPS or AVG response times show in the UI. This bug happens calls equals error calls only, we consider that it is a small probability event, but some user hit with this issue whom we communicate by QQ and Github issues. They initiates the call from their applications, but we show the zero in our UI, they will deem the agent not work.
 In the feature, we can discuss about how many metrics will show in UI, but now, fixed the bug only.

@peng-yongsheng I agree with you. But which also means, there are more than these two places need to fix. It is about all tps metric calculation.

@candyleer Can you update the pr by following Peng's suggestions? I am OK with this updates.
@candyleer I can help you to find all places which need to fixed.
I got `BUILD SUCCESS` after I run `mvn source:jar`. Do you run this in `master` branch? From my experience, our Apache release already includes the source code jars. This should work.

I think this is a bug of `xmemcached` plugin. All classes defined in `XMemcachedInstrumentation` miss the interceptor's package name. 

Can you send a pull request by adding `org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.xmemcached.v2.` in front of our class names: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/e72f668bfbe5c4d5b6ef5255d1abebb70da598ce/apm-sniffer/apm-sdk-plugin/xmemcached-2.x-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/plugin/xmemcached/v2/define/XMemcachedInstrumentation.java#L47-L51
@IluckySi Because you have still not provided your auto test cases, this bug can't be detected before release. Please provide as soon as you can.

@wu-sheng This PR modify the implementation, not change the usage mode of the script. The document contains the instructions about this script.

but nothing about agent report trace . how  find no work reason？

If no error and no trace, you should check the agent log about `classes enhanced`. Find out which classes has been instrumented, and do your serve provider components/frameworks have been supported. See our supported list.

Then, if still no clue, I think you have to provide a small application based on your tech stack, let @ascrutae help you locate the issue.

If you want to do this by yourself, try to learn `remote debug` in IntelliJ, and debug agent in that way.

@50168383  
Thanks for your mention! This is Jedis's bug.

To resolve this bug you can do the following steps:
1. find `org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.jedis.v2.define.JedisClusterInstrumentation` class file
2. find  `Jorg.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.jedis.v2.edisClusterConstructorWithListHostAndPortArgInterceptor` and then replace it to `org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.jedis.v2.JedisClusterConstructorWithListHostAndPortArgInterceptor`
3. pull an pull request to Skywalking.
